channel.title: Windows XP or Vista Torrent?
channel.description:
Does anyone know or could link me to a 100% working torrent for reformatting my desktop computer? I'm using XP right now and I'd prefer an XP torrent over a Vista one, but beggars can't be choosers.
I'm like 90% sure topics like these aren't allowed, but honestly, I don't trust myself downloading a torrent like this without it having some sort of virus or malware in it. I trust, as odd as that sounds, and would rather ask the people in this community if they know of one anywhere because I know the people here quite well. And if one worked for you then it should work for me too.

item.title: Windows XP or Vista Torrent?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Warez links are not allowed, but I suggest just checking through the comments, as said above, should be fine providing 5 or more people say it’s alright.
Oh and, go for Windows 7, uses less resources than Vista, and still looks perty.

Read full topic

item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

Well what if someone private messaged me their product license for their xp disc. How many times can the product key be used on different computers?

item.title: Windows XP or Vista Torrent?
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

CoonHunter:

Its a bit troublesome to have to search out specific programs that are compatible sometimes. While in Windows, you can get the program easily.

If you use a distribution with APT installing a piece of software e.g. Google Chrome is as simple as:

sudo apt-get install chromium-browser

I have not yet found a Windows program I could not replace on Linux apart from games (however I can run most of my games under Wine).

Canownueazy:

Windows has the most functionality, most features, easiest to use, and most importantly, far better performance.

Are you joking? Linux boots up in 10 seconds for me whereas Windows takes at least 30 seconds. As soon as Linux is booted I can actually start doing stuff whereas in Windows there is always that initial delay while other stuff gets loaded. Linux uses less RAM and CPU power when it is doing nothing so my other applications can run faster (why does Windows 7 take up almost 1 GB after it has just booted?). Also in terms of programming/developing, Linux completely owns Windows since there is a decent command line.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP or Vista Torrent?
item.dc:creator: @Canownueazy Canownueazy
item.description:
@Canownueazy wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:6, topic:376404”][quote author=Canownueazy link=topic=472336.msg3454521#msg3454521 date=1293955429]
Linux is no where near as good as Windows. Yeah, it’s an okay, reliable, free solution. But facts are facts, clients almost always have a machine using a Windows OS. Windows has the most functionality, most features, easiest to use, and most importantly, far better performance.

Idiots think because Linux benchmarks faster that it’s performance is better. This is FALSE. Windows is incredibly more advanced than Linux, and EXPECTS CERTAIN MACHINE SPECS.
[/quote]
You just had a controversy with yourself.

Linux is better than windows for the fact of, it runs cleaner. Just because windows has more functionality, more people use it, etc does not mean it is a better all around OS. A better OS is one that has the functionality people need and will actually use, rather than an OS stuck with features they expect people to need, and normally never get used.[/quote]Well I definitely take advantage of near all the features Windows has to offer

Read full topic

Idiots think because Linux benchmarks faster that it’s performance is better. This is FALSE. Windows is incredibly more advanced than Linux, and EXPECTS CERTAIN MACHINE SPECS.[/quote]
You just had a controversy with yourself.

Linux is better than windows for the fact of, it runs cleaner. Just because windows has more functionality, more people use it, etc does not mean it is a better all around OS. A better OS is one that has the functionality people need and will actually use, rather than an OS stuck with features they expect people to need, and normally never get used.

item.title: Windows XP or Vista Torrent?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I would give you a copy of my CD, but I never got it back from my uncle. Only got 1 left and I’m not bound to make a copy of it. Anyways, as Lin said, find one with comments, or, find one with a ton of seeders, if many people are seeding it, its prolly a good one.

@Vain - Linux, is better than windows yes, but to the average user no. Its a bit troublesome to have to search out specific programs that are compatible sometimes. While in Windows, you can get the program easily. All depends on how custom to Windows you have become.

Read full topic
